listing_jobDesc: Data AnalistKrijg jij energie van inzichten uit data, die een grote impact maken voor een organisatie? Ben jij graag bezig met jezelf ontwikkelen en houd je van diversiteit in je werk? Veneficus is op zoek naar jou om het team te komen versterken!Bij ons ben je niet alleen onderdeel van een gezellige en enthousiaste groep van 50 collega’s, maar ook onderdeel van een team bij je klant.Wij bieden jou de kans om toffe en uitdagende data-opdrachten aan te pakken in diverse branches, zoals: finance, verzekeringen, retail, transport, overheid, logistiek, energie, etc.Met zorg kijken we samen naar de juiste opdracht die aansluit bij jouw wensen en ambities. Als data-analist breng jij duidelijkheid over de vraagstukken van de klant en ben jij de onmisbare schakel in ieder project.Je kunt werken waar je wilt, op ons kantoor of het kantoor van de klant, vanuit huis, of in goed overleg vanaf je vakantieadres.Jezelf continue blijven ontwikkelen, dat is iets wat centraal staat bij Veneficus. Dit doen wij door het volgende aan jou te bieden: een persoonlijk ontwikkel plan, een mooi ontwikkelingsbudget en een maandelijkse update met jouw Talent manager of Accountmanager. Op deze manier creëren wij voor jou de ruimte om het beste uit jezelf te halen!Wat ga je doen?Bij ons wordt je als data-analist ingezet op verschillende opdrachten, die passen bij jouw kennis, ervaring en ambities. De meeste opdrachten variëren van een half jaar tot 12 maanden. We hebben een breed netwerk en dat betekent dat je in diverse branches aan de slag gaat.We kunnen dus niet in onze glazenbol kijken, om te zien aan welk project jij gaat werken. Natuurlijk willen we je wel zicht geven op wat je kunt verwachten in een functie als data analist:Veel contact onderhouden met diverse stakeholders;Prioriteiten stellen in alle wensen en eisen van de stakeholders;Requirements opstellen;Op een innovatieve manier processen verbeteren;Dashboards maken en vervolgens presenteren aan bijvoorbeeld het management.Al met al dus scheppen van orde in de chaos! Dit biedt jou natuurlijk een onderzoekende, variërende en bovenal data gedreven uitdaging.Het doel is in ieder geval duidelijk: Samen met je collega’s ga jij aan de slag om de opdracht succesvol te laten verlopen en écht waarde en kwaliteit toe te voegen aan het project.Wie ben jij?Even genoeg over ons. Nu over jou!Jij neemt mee:Een HBO- of WO-diploma in de richting van bijvoorbeeld Econometrie, Data Science, Toegepaste Wiskunde of een andere bèta opleiding;Jij hebt al minimaal 3 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke functie;Je hebt ruime ervaring met SQL en PowerBI of Tableau (of een andere visualisatietool);Je hebt al (enige) ervaring met Azure of AWS;Je hebt eventueel ervaring met Python en GIT;Jij spreekt en schrijft Nederlands op minimaal B2 niveau;Je woont in de Randstad of in Brabant en jij vindt reizen niet vervelend;Jij bent tussen de 32 tot 40 uur per week beschikbaar.Je familie, vrienden en oud-collega’s zouden jou zo omschrijven:Je bent communicatief sterk en vindt het dan ook leuk om in een team te werken;Jij hebt een oplossingsgerichte instelling;Analytisch ben jij sterk;Initiatief tonen durf jij & proactief werken dat doe jij van nature.Wat bieden wij jou?Een contract voor 12 maanden, met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband;Een bruto salaris tussen de € 3200 en € 4500 per maand;25 vakantiedagen o.b.v. fulltime en 8% vakantiegeld;Opbouw van pensioen;Een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling;NS-businesscard en eventueel een Swapfiets;De mogelijkheid om te werken waar je wil (hybride) en zelfs in goed overleg remote;Uiteraard zorgen wij voor een laptop en alles voor een fijne thuiswerkplek;Veel aandacht en ruimte voor jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Denk hierbij aan een ruim opleidingsbudget, maandelijkse voortgangsgesprekken, studieavonden, soft-skill trainingen etc.Maandelijkse teamuitjes, wekelijkse vrijdagmiddagborrels en nog veel meer sociale activiteiten!Soort dienstverband: VoltijdsSalaris: €3.200,00 - €4.500,00 per maandAanvullende vergoedingen:BonusregelingVakantiegeldArbeidsvoorwaarden:FietsplanReiskostenvergoedingWerk vanuit huisWerkschema:Dagdienstma-vrErvaring:Data analyse: 3 jaar (Vereist)Taal:Nederlands (Vereist) Data AnalistKrijg jij energie van inzichten uit data, die een grote impact maken voor een organisatie? Data Science ConsultantWil jij graag werken als Data Science Consultant en jouw kennis toepassen in het online marketing domein? Lijkt het je mooi om dit vanuit een snel groeiend -6-koppig- data science team te doen waarin jullie samenwerken en veel ruimte krijgen om te innoveren en van elkaar te leren? Lees dan verder.Als data science consultant help je klanten en collega’s met het verzamelen, analyseren en gebruiken van data om inzicht te krijgen en verbeterkansen te identificeren. Voor verdieping en onderbouwing gebruik je experimenten, machine learning en optimization modellen. Zo werk je samen aan het verbeteren van online marketing op het snijvlak van data, business processen en creativiteit.Wat ga je doen?Toepassen van optimization technieken op klantvraagstukken. Op basis van analyse en experimenten kom je met onderbouwde adviezen over de inzet van online marketing. Denk dan aan klantvragen over het optimale budget, realiteit van doelstellingen of de potentie van nieuwe marketingkanalen;Verbeteren van beslissingen door inzet van machine learning. Wat mag een nieuwe klant kosten, wat is de beste inzet van kortingbudget of hoeveel kunnen we verkopen als we de prijzen veranderen?;Koppelen van databronnen om analyses of dashboards mogelijk te maken, bijvoorbeeld CRM-, Google Analytics en Google Ads data. Afhankelijk van de situatie pak je dit op middels Excel, Python of via Cloud Engines;Optimaliseren van de data science methoden en processen van Netprofiler;Delen van kennis en skills met je collega’s en klanten.Naast data science krijg je ook een rol binnen één van de andere online marketing disciplines. Op deze manier krijg je diepere kennis over de vragen die spelen zodat je goed op de hoogte bent van de uitdagingen van online marketeers. Hierin mag je uiteraard je voorkeur aangeven. Denk aan: zoekmachine marketing, Marketplaces, Display, SEO etc.Waar kom je terecht?Netprofiler is het online marketingbureau dat strategie en uitvoering combineert onder één dak. In 15 jaar zijn we uitgegroeid tot een bureau dat jaar op jaar in de top van de Emerce 100 staat. Met onze expertise, ambitie en frisse energie maken wij iedere dag het verschil voor grote corporates en ambitieuze Mkb’ers. Wij werken samen met onze klanten aan hun online groei.Netprofiler is onderdeel van de LevelUp Group, een samenwerking tussen meerdere marketingbureaus. De groep groeit hard, is ambitieus en heeft daarnaast het doel om medewerkers de beste werkplek te bieden. Dat jij je fijn voelt op werk is topprioriteit. Daarom meten en optimaliseren we medewerkerstevredenheid doorlopend. We geloven namelijk dat optimale medewerkerstevredenheid leidt tot de beste resultaten voor klanten. Om dat te realiseren, werven we uitdagende klanten, zorgen we voor goede werkcondities en een collegiale, stimulerende omgeving waarin je fijn samenwerkt en optimaal professioneel ontwikkelt. Medewerkers van Netprofiler waarderen hun tevredenheid inmiddels ruim boven de 8.LevelUp Group opereert vanuit concrete kernwaarden die in de afgelopen 15 jaar onze cultuur zijn gaan kenmerken:We groeien door interactieWe hebben oog voor elkaar en de wereld om ons heenWe zijn positief en constructiefWe zorgen voor aantoonbare groeiHet resultaat is dat collega’s lang blijven -meer dan 5 jaar dienstverband is geen uitzondering- en flinke carrièrestappen zetten. Naast het harde werken is er veel ruimte voor ontspanning en lol, zowel op de werkvloer als buiten werk om.Wat bieden we?Bij ons kun je als Data Science Consultant rekenen op:Een vast maandsalaris tussen €2.500 - €4.000 (exclusief vakantiegeld), afhankelijk van je werkervaring;Bonus aan het einde van het jaar;Keuze uit een 32-, 36- of 40-urige werkweek;Laptop en telefoon van de zaak;Reiskostenvergoeding per km als je met de auto komt en 100% reiskostenvergoeding voor OV;Pensioenbijdrage: de hoogte is afhankelijk van je salaris en groeit ieder jaar. Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om via ons bij Bright Pensioen te beleggen. Wij betalen de rekening;Een thuiswerkvergoeding voor de dagen dat je thuis werkt. Hybride werken is de norm sinds Corona. We zien je graag regelmatig op kantoor verschijnen, maar je mag ook dagen thuiswerken;Een budget voor het inrichten van je thuiswerkplek;Een duidelijk groeipad met goede begeleiding en een opleidingsbudget van €1500,- per jaar dat je naar eigen keuze kan inzetten;Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar Senior-, Lead- en Managing Consultant;Op kantoor dagelijks een verse lunch, goede koffie en een uitgebreid assortiment aan (gezonde) snacks en lekkers;Uitnodigingen voor alle borrels, teamuitjes en de jaarlijkse wintersport;De mogelijkheid om onder werktijd vier dagen per jaar te besteden aan maatschappelijk verantwoorde projecten;Een Workation waarin je een week per jaar samen met collega’s kan werken vanaf een zonnige locatie in Europa.Data science is volop in ontwikkeling. Daarom krijgen alle medewerkers bij Netprofiler een stevig persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget met daarnaast veel tijd en ruimte voor het verbeteren van de dienstverlening. Zo groei je optimaal, zowel persoonlijk als professioneel.Functie-eisenJe bent zelfstandig, maar werkt ook goed in teamverband. Je bent analytisch, nieuwsgierig aangelegd en WO afgestudeerd. Je hebt basale ervaring opgedaan met programmeren en hebt affiniteit met machine learning, modellering en optimalisatie.Verder herken je jezelf in het volgende profiel:Minstens 1 jaar werkervaring sinds je bent afgestudeerd;Een relevant WO-diploma;Ervaring met programmeren in Python of R;Kennis op het gebied van Machine Learning: praktische ervaring is een pre;Ervaringen met systemen als Google Analytics, BigQuery, Google Ads, Data Studio zijn ook een pre;Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlands en Engelse taal;Super gemotiveerd om tot de top te behoren op het snijvlak van online marketing en data science.Ben je enthousiast over deze functie? Stuur ons dan je CV en motivatiebrief. Wil je eerst nog wat vragen stellen? Are you as an Data Scientist ready for the next step in your career? Xomnia offers you this opportunity! We are looking for a Data Scientist who is comfortable developing machine learning models ready for production. Someone who can lead our data science projects from the ideation phase into implementation and deployment whilst having one goal in mind, making the impact that our clients expect from working with Xomnia.

We believe in a can and will do mentality, and leading by example. As a Data Scientist at Xomnia you will work together with other experienced analytics translators, data scientists and engineers on challenging AI projects. In these projects you take on complex business problems from different domains such as fraud & anomaly detection, time series forecasts and recommender systems. From experience you know how to handle large volumes of data and apply the right kind of algorithm to the domain. You take pride in the work you create and develop according to the best practices in coding, because models should live in production environments and not only in jupyter notebooks.

You're eager and dedicated to keep on learning and developing yourself. It is rewarding for you to develop solutions together with your team that run in production, and make the impact that the organizations we partner with are looking for! And you enjoy celebrating these successes together.

What you will need
A minimum of 2 years experience in a position as data scientist, machine learning engineer, or similar
Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Econometrics or similar
Knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Excellent programming skills in Python
Experience with containerization in Docker
Experience in working with at (least) one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Enjoy sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourself
Team player with strong communication skills
What we offer
Competitive salary
25 vacation days and the possibility of taking unpaid leave
Room to grow and develop yourself
Paid time for self development and training budget of €5,000 a year
Challenging assignments
Company laptop of your choice
Work from home package
A monthly in-depth training facilitated by colleagues or external trainers
Nice colleagues who besides work also like to undertake activities
Company trips and activities like the Xomnia WKD, ski trip, and weekly sports activities
About us

We are Xomnia, the AI consulting company. We’re curious problem-solvers who believe data will change the way we live, work and communicate. Being at the forefront of this revolutionary change in a sustainable, positive way is what drives us.

We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.

Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses and it still feels like home. Like any family, we all feel comfortable just being ourselves.
Note; For this specific position, we are looking for a candidate that has an EU citizenship as we don’t offer any visa sponsorship. Vacancy: Technology Consultant Data & Analytics
Location: From home, from one our offices in Hoofddorp, Barendrecht or Apeldoorn and on-site with our customers (when possible)
Hours: 32 – 40

Data is hot, especially in this day and age. Many companies recognize the value of data, but do not have a clear understanding of what they can do with it. Macaw helps customers with everything around data by inspiring and guiding them towards a future proof and valuable data platform that can support all traditional and innovative data-driven workloads, so that the customer has valuable information. We do this at Basic Fit, Heineken, PWN, Vivat, Henkel and ABN AMRO and many others.

Working at Macaw as a Technology Consultant Data & Analytics

More than 500 colleagues work at Macaw internationally, of which about 60 are primarily involved with data. This covers all of data: from traditional Business Intelligence solutions and Smart Data Platforms (SDP) to the more advanced Analytics solutions with Ai and Data Science. Within the Data & Analytics team there are 2 MVPs, Dave Ruijter and Marc Lelijveld.

Collaboration is focused on individual and team responsibility, working together in a professional manner, addressing and helping each other, finding balance with each other, sharing knowledge and certainly also celebrating successes together. We are a driven group of people who work hard and share a lot of fun with each other.

As an Azure Data Architect you take a pioneering role towards our customers. Not only do you have clear customer expectations, but you also have a good idea of the risks. You are involved with the customer from the pre sales phase. Thanks to your extensive technical knowledge and the experience you have gained with the Azure Data Platform, Data Lake and Databricks, you are able to advise your customer and inspire them from your own enthusiasm and charisma. You create a roadmap with which the team (with Data Engineers, for example) can start building the solution under your guidance.

In addition to your role towards the customer, as a Lead you are responsible for the team. You help the team in the start-up phase of the project, but also during the project you remain involved up to and including the go live. You supervise the team during the project. You also help them in their personal development.

Within your group of Data Consultants you will find like-minded people who spar with each other about the field and challenge each other. Together you are leading the charge in terms of technology within Macaw. By working closely with the Microsoft Product teams, you can actually contribute to the further development of new technology such as Azure Synapse Analytics. You have a vision of how we can use this in a valuable way for our customers.

We are looking for a highly experienced, senior candidate for this role, who wants to join the team immediately and achieve success together with our colleagues!

“Working with the latest techniques and ensuring that the customer can handle them!” – Dave Ruijter, working as Lead Consultant Data & Analytics

Macaw offers

We offer a complete package of employment conditions, including:

a competitive salary
29 vacation days
an excellent pension
a lot of attention for your work/life balance
the flexibility to further shape your role
compensation for a home workplace
Budget available for training
What we are looking for
Higher education or academic background
You already work and live in the Netherlands
At least 5 years of working experience in the data engineering field
At least 3 years of working experience on Azure Data Platform, SQL Datawarehouse, Data Lake and Databricks
Solid knowledge of Azure Cloud
Interest in new technologies like Azure Synapse Analytics
Fluent in Dutch and / or English is mandatory
Power BI knowledge is preferred

Machine learning engineers first and foremost sit at the intersection of software engineering, data science, and DevOps. You work together with data scientists and engineers in a team to build production-ready, scalable machine learning systems.

About us

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for people who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Working as a ML Engineer through Xccelerated: what is that like?
Every ML engineer kicks off with two full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training. This intensive training focuses on writing deployable code with Python, containerization, data processing at large scale with Apache Spark and Kafka, and cloud fundamentals. Participants learn through classroom lectures, short assignments, hackathons and collaborative project assignments. Our ML Engineering Lead chooses the best training approach for the topic, depending on your needs.

After these 2 kick off weeks, you’ll work four days a week at the location of one of our partner organizations and one day a week at the Xccelerated office/on remote — which involves ongoing training and project support from our technical leads. At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly.

The role itself

As a ML Engineer you will work together with other medior- and senior team members on challenging projects for our clients. In these projects you will work on data science & ML related topics, such as predictive software solutions, fraud detection or data engineering challenges such as building data pipelines, developing on cloud architectures and productionizing machine learning models.

Besides this, you like big data tools and programming frameworks to ensure that the raw data gathered from data pipelines are used to build production-ready scalable applications driven by data and AI.
Who are you? You have:

A technical bachelor’s or master’s degree (e.g. computer science, informatics, artificial intelligence, software engineering)
2-5 years of work experience as a ML Engineer or Data scientist
Statistical knowledge, but are mainly experienced with end to end systems and able to run, deploy and monitor them.
Preferably experience with the entire data pipeline (from data storage to model development)
Knowledge of open-source technologies like Spark, Kafka, Airflow and Kubernetes
Good communication skills
What we offer

Good salary
25 vacation days
Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training
Technical trainings & Innovation days (every week)
Challenging assignments
Company laptop (Macbook)
Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar
Flexibility in working from home & at the office
Working at one of our partner companies (e.g. Heineken, ING, Randstad Group, FedEx, Vattenfall, Lely)

Interested? We’d love to meet you!

Please get in touch! Contact Samantha Alves Goncalves at sgoncalves@xccelerated.io or by phone at 0613889770.

Welcome to SkillLab
At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. To realise this vision, we develop a mobile app to provide skill based career guidance to job seekers around the globe.

Your opportunity
You will perform cutting-edge data science work to improve our career guidance solution.
You will be working in an agile product development team and quickly see the results of your data science work in our product.
You will learn how to use advanced NLP models to enable job seekers to better find jobs and education.
You will experience the culture of a technology start-up with a social mission, working in a team with people from 12 countries, using English as their shared language.
Your team
You will join our product team as the new data scientist:
Aaron is our Lead Data Scientist. With a Phd in Theoretical Physics and a career as Quant-Trader at Commerzbank and Data Scientist at Leiden University, Aaron combines the theoretical and practical skills needed to excel at any artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science project. Aaron will be your supervisor and you will work with him on a daily basis.
Ragnar leads the Product Team and manages our product workflow. You will work closely with him.
Gaspar, Jesus, Victor and Aaron are SkillLab’s software engineers
Giulia is our Senior Product Designer
Giulia is our UX Designer
Azza supports the user research in her role as Customer Success and Reporting Specialist.


Your impact
You will collaborate with the Lead Data Scientist and product team to help understand new skill & occupation taxonomies and integrate new data sources into our product.
You will help develop, train and maintain SkillLab’s award winning skill-recommender engine.
You will supervise a team of data annotators and perform data science work to improve the work of those data annotators.
You will analyse and evaluate end-user data and communicate findings with other team members using reporting tools and visualization libraries.
Requirements
Is this you?
You speak Arabic (Must have criteria for this role!)
You have at least 3 years of relevant work experience
You have knowledge of Python including libraries such as pandas
You have knowledge of common NLP models such as TFIDF
You have experience working with REST APIs and SQL
You are excited about our social mission to empower everyone to have a pathway to employment
You have a learning mindset and bring the drive and curiosity to tackle new data science challenges
Extra awesome
You have extensive knowledge of advancing taxonomies using NLP models
You have experience with docker and deploying your own models
You have have experience with ideating, developing and evaluating machine learning models
You have experience building dashboards with Google Data Studio, PowerBI or similar visualization tools
You have experience setting up data-connectors to and from connectors like Mixpanel, Google Tag Manager, and similar tools
Salary & start-date
We use a salary benchmark for the Dutch high-tech sector to set your salary based on your experience. We expect that the annual gross salary for the experience we are looking for ranges from 54k-63k Euro per year.
We prefer on-site candidates in Amsterdam / the Netherlands. However, we are open to remote applicants who will make intermittent trips to Amsterdam.
We accept applications on a rolling basis, and prefer a start-date in mid-September ‘22.
Benefits
Your personal growth
You will learn how to use AI to address a major social problem of our times: Enabling job seekers to better find jobs and education.
You can easily access your learning budget to invest in your personal development.
You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator).
You will learn from your colleagues during company-wide lunch learning exchanges.
You will receive detailed feedback from your peers and team lead at least twice per year.
Practicalities
You can work flexibly from our office in Amsterdam, or remotely with intermittent trips to Amsterdam if you live in other cities of the Netherlands.
You will get relocation support to move to Amsterdam, including visa and 30% ruling application
You will get work equipment and commuting support if you don’t live in Amsterdam.
You will enjoy 25 paid vacation days per year, and additional leave (e.g. parental leave).

What else to know?
SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds.

Wat ga je doen?
Bij Menzis zijn we constant bezig ons als zorgverzekeraar te verbeteren. Het slim analyseren en gebruiken van een diversiteit aan data speelt daarin een cruciale rol. Daarbij halen wij zoveel mogelijk waarde uit de data met diverse tools en ontsluiten wij nieuwe databronnen, doen we analyses en ontwikkelen we ML modellen.

Hoe complexer, hoe mooier jij het vindt. Je werkt aan verschillende Data Science en ML-projecten met een breed scala aan onderwerpen. En je doet dit op een nieuw en state-of-the-art dataplatform in Azure dat momenteel in opbouw is en waar je ook bijdraagt aan het inrichten van de Data Science Lab binnen deze omgeving. Je trekt daarbij intensief op met collega data-engineers / data-scientists met wie je ook je kennis deelt. Als Senior heb je daarnaast veel ervaring met data Science ben je in staat om jouw collega’s te begeleiden op dit vakgebied. Dankzij jou kunnen wij erop vertrouwen dat onze data-pipelines en ML modellen robuust gebouwd zijn en voldoen aan onze kwaliteitseisen.


Wat breng je mee?
Dat je voor de functie van (senior) Data Engineer / Scientist over een ijzersterk analytisch vermogen beschikt, is duidelijk. een WO-diploma Wiskunde, Data Analytics, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie of een vergelijkbaar diploma.
minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als data engineer / data scientist (minimaal 5 jaar voor senior rol).
ervaring met Python (kennis van object oriented programming, algorithms en data-structures) en met met diverse Python libraries zoals Pandas, NumPy, SciKitLearn, XGboost, Seaborn, Keras, Pytorch.

ruime ervaring en/of certificeringen op het gebied van Microsoft Azure, in de richting analytics/data engineering.
ervaring met continous integration en continuous delivery.
een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.

Wat breng je mee?
Dat je voor de functie van (senior) Data Engineer / Scientist over een ijzersterk analytisch vermogen beschikt, is duidelijk. Je bent communicatief sterk en in staat om jouw kennis te delen met collega’s binnen en buiten het team. Het is voor jou geen probleem om Agile te werken. Daarnaast beschik je over:
een WO-diploma Wiskunde, Data Analytics, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie of een vergelijkbaar diploma.
minimaal 2 jaar ervaring als data engineer / data scientist (minimaal 5 jaar voor senior rol).
ervaring met Python (kennis van object oriented programming, algorithms en data-structures) en met met diverse Python libraries zoals Pandas, NumPy, SciKitLearn, XGboost, Seaborn, Keras, Pytorch.
ervaring met Spark en/of Databricks.
ruime ervaring en/of certificeringen op het gebied van Microsoft Azure, in de richting analytics/data engineering.
ervaring met continous integration en continuous delivery.
een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.

Wat krijg je terug?
We bieden je een afwisselende baan in een hybride werkomgeving. We werken zowel vanuit huis als op kantoor. Samenwerking, flexibiliteit en leefkracht vinden we belangrijk. Leefkracht gaat over de positieve kracht van gezond leven, zodat je de dingen kunt doen die voor jou belangrijk zijn. Menzis faciliteert verschillende mogelijkheden om je leefkracht te versterken. Zo hebben we het gezondheidsprogramma SamenGezond, in een omgeving die speciaal voor medewerkers is ontwikkeld. Natuurlijk krijg je ook een marktconform arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket met een vaste eindejaarsuitkering en goede studiefaciliteiten. Bovendien kun je gebruikmaken van de collectieve zorgverzekering (met korting op de basisverzekering en de aanvullende verzekeringen), voordelig sporten bij een groot aantal geselecteerde fitnesscentra en kennen we een mooie sabbaticalregeling. De functie is, afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring, gewaardeerd in schaal 10 of 11 van de CAO voor Zorgverzekeraars (minimaal € 3.023,- en maximaal € 5.797,- bruto per maand voor 36 uur per week).

Is this you?

You love to solve real world problems with data & algorithms. You can bridge the gap between Data Scientists, Data Engineers & DevOps. And you are highly motivated to create valuable solutions for our customers with the latest machine learning, cloud and MLOps technologies.

Your role

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer at Future Facts you are at the center of productionizing our AI solutions. You will coach, train and lead the team on the latest innovations in ML. You will orchestrate data pipelines for model training and prediction, industrialize and train ML algorithms and build high performance, low latency API’s.

You will do this in close co-operation with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other stakeholders and will have the lead in code reviews and pair programming sessions. Therefore, it is key that your knowledge of code and CI/CD best practices is solid.

You will work on different ML projects with a wide range of topics. Projects we have done in the past include topics like; package return prediction for a Logistics company, fraud detection for an Insurance company and subscription cancel prediction for a Telecom company. Depending on the projects you will work either on site or remote.

Since most of our clients work in agile, DevOps and cloud environments, we have adapted this into our standards.

A few examples

At Dura Vermeer, a smart building concept has been set up in Azure by means of AI & IoT, in which occupancy rate and atmosphere are calculated and processed in real time. This is crucial for the health of the company's employees.
For a large waste processor we use computer vision and camera-wide inspection to detect the different waste flows and to find out how they can be optimized for processing.
What you get
A competitive salary with a nice bonus package, a phone and laptop are of course included. We'd like to go a bit further and offer you a mobility budget, a private internet plan and a general expense allowance
A learning and development budget and personal development scheme
A steady job in a company that has over 24 years of expertise in data
A young and ambitious team of data fanatics to share knowledge with
A flexible workspace where you can organize your work-life balance just the way you like it
Our very own Danz Café with roof terrace and lots of team events where you can socialize with your colleagues
Weekly chair massage, gym with personal training and a company longboat to go out into the Amsterdam canals
What you need

As a Principal Machine Learning Engineer, Machine Learning infrastructure is something you know everything about. Besides that, it is mandatory that you can communicate complex concepts and make them understandable for other disciplines, both technical and non-technical. To do this you need to be a team player and have excellent communication skills.
English speakers are welcome to apply, but you need to be able to understand Dutch to some extend and have the willingness to learn it.

Our ideal candidate would look like this:
A MSc or PhD in e.g. Computer Science or other STEM related fields, +4 years of experience as a Machine Learning- or Software Engineer
Experience with ML frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc. preferably on large scale projects
Deep understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning related concepts
Hands on programming skills in Python, experience with API design and the DevOps and CI/CD way of working
Knowledge of big data processing tools, platforms and infrastructures such as Spark, PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks Linux, Docker, Kubernetes (nice to have),
Experience with Cloud frameworks like AWS, Azure or GCP
Experience with both SQL and NoSQL
Anything else you’d like to add?
Your Future Facts?

With a skilled and ambitious team of 30+ data professionals you will work on projects for new and existing clients all over the Netherlands where you will implement valuable AI solutions. We actively pursue projects in many different sectors. A few examples of our clients are PostNL, IKEA, ANWB, VodafoneZiggo and NS.

Our data engineers and data scientists focus on productionizing valuable machine learning & AI solutions, and developing and deploying Machine Learning models. Every project is different, and therefore needs a different approach. With your team, you will determine the most efficient approach, and the appropriate tooling for each project. Your expertise and seniority makes you the perfect advisor on how to implement the solutions. Is this you?

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join a team building our Data Platform and centralized Data Lake. This team develops scalable distributed systems that process massive datasets from diverse sources. We’re looking for someone with a high standard of technical excellence who is ready to collaborate and lead in creating solutions to hard data problems.

Design and implement data storage structures and scalable distributed ETL pipelines to bring disparate data sources into a unified data lake in AWS cloud
Leverage tools for building distributed systems such as Kafka, Spark, Parquet, Aurora, Cassandra, Redis, SQS, SNS, S3, and more
Replace legacy systems with more modern and up-to-date data pipelines and operational systems
Contribute and review architectural designs for scalable, extensible distributed systems
Influence technical strategy via research, experimentation, POCs, and prototypes
Mentor less senior members of your team
Demonstrate empathy, respect, professionalism, and fairness in everything you do

Job requirements and qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related technical field, or equivalent work experience
4+ years of experience in a data engineering role, preferably within a fast-growing SaaS business, using one or more of: Java, Python, and/or Scala
4+ years of experience engineering software that leverages cloud computing platforms (preferably AWS) and container orchestration (preferably Kubernetes)
2+ years of experience architecting and implementing scalable distributed systems that process massive amounts of data
1+ years of experience of contributing thought leadership, including creation and review of architectural designs, and mentorship for junior engineers
Deep understanding of the tradeoffs for various types of databases such as relational, key/value, columnar, etc. and their use cases such as data warehousing, data lakes, caching, etc.
An appreciation of engineering rigor and non-functional requirements
An appreciation of a respectful and empathetic team culture
Fluent knowledge of English (written & spoken).
Must be authorized to work in the Netherlands.

Additional/preferred skills (but not required):

Experience with AI/ML techniques

Data Engineers are first and foremost the software engineers of the analytical world. You like to help data-driven organizations move, process and store data by building data warehouses, data lakes, lake houses and distributed data meshes. Sometimes you’ll also collaborate with data scientists to deploy, monitor and scale machine learning solutions and data products.

About us

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for people who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Working as a Data Engineer through Xccelerated: what is that like?
Every Data engineer kicks off with two full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training. This intensive training focuses on writing deployable code with Python, containerization, data processing at large scale with Apache Spark and Kafka, and cloud fundamentals. Participants learn through classroom lectures, short assignments, hackathons and collaborative project assignments. Our Data Engineering Lead chooses the best training approach for the topic, depending on your needs.

After these 2 kick off weeks, you’ll work four days a week at the location of one of our partner organizations and one day a week at the Xccelerated office/on remote — which involves ongoing training and project support from our technical leads. At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly.

The role itself

As a Data Engineer you will work together with other medior- and senior team members on challenging projects for our clients. In these projects you take on complex problems such as building data pipelines, productionizing machine learning models and building custom software solutions.
Part of the job is dealing with a variety of data types and formats; different data velocity from batch to near-real time; and scale from one machine to distributed systems. You’re not afraid to get your hands dirty with infrastructure, either in the cloud or on-premises. And most importantly you apply engineering practices to pick the best tools for the job, balancing complexity, maintainability, speed of development, quality and value.

Besides this, you like to develop and maintain data infrastructure and data intensive applications; like to create insights and make data available for data teams and like to deploy and configure data infrastructure.

Who are you? You have:

A technical bachelor’s or master’s degree (e.g. computer science, informatics, artificial intelligence, software engineering)
2-5 years of work experience as a data engineer or software engineer
Knowledge of open-source technologies like Spark, Kafka, Airflow and Kubernetes
Preferably experience in one of the major cloud environments (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Good communication skills
What we offer

Good salary
25 vacation days
Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training
Technical trainings & Innovation days (every week)
Challenging assignments
Company laptop (Macbook)
Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar
Flexibility in working from home & at the office
Working at one of our partner companies (e.g. Heineken, ING, Randstad Group, FedEx, Vattenfall, Lely)

Every Data engineer kicks off with two full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training. job_title: Data engineer en data scientist in eHealth
listing_jobDesc:
Analyseer en bouw jij mee aan datagedreven projecten en wil je deze omtoveren in waardevolle inzichten die zorgverleners in de psychologie direct toepassen? Kom bij ons werken als data engineer en data scientist!

Hoe ziet je dag eruit?


Nadat je je eerste kopje koffie hebt genomen bespreek je de status van verschillende data projecten binnen het data team. Je werkt dagelijks aan uitdagende projecten die in het teken staan van het data driven worden van Therapieland. Vandaag ligt de focus op het uitbreiden van het data warehouse, waarvoor je samen met je team van vijf collega’s een sterke strategie ontwikkelt.

Aan het eind van de dag bereid je je alvast voor om morgen aan de slag te gaan met het te implementeren recommendation system

Jouw functie:

Als lid van het datateam ben je continu op zoek naar de beste manier om onze data te organiseren en analyseren. Hiermee help je Therapieland om de waarde van de verschillende oplossingen inzichtelijk te maken zodat we de juiste beslissingen kunnen nemen. Wij zoeken een data engineer die de ambitie heeft om elk stukje van de data puzzel op te lossen, van beheer en uitbreiding van het data warehouse, het bouwen van data pipelines, tot de implementatie van datagestuurde oplossingen in een cloud omgeving. Samen met je collega’s bespreek je de talloze keuzes die hierbij te maken zijn en zorg je voor automatisering van het proces.

Binnen deze functie ligt de prioriteit op data engineering, maar er zal ook ruimte zijn om data science projecten op te pakken.

Jouw taken


Het ontwerpen, implementeren en beheren van data pipelines;
Het organiseren, ontsluiten, en beheren van relevante data voor Therapieland uit verschillende databronnen in Google cloud.
Het beveiligen, schonen, transformeren, converteren, voorbewerken, integreren en optimaliseren van data, en het beschikbaar en toegankelijk maken van deze data in een analyse-omgeving zodat deze bruikbaar is voor data science en BI-tooling.
Complexe statistische analyses uitvoeren in programmeertalen zoals R, Python en MATLAB.
Data modelling
Wie zijn wij dan?

Vanuit onze locatie aan het IJ in Amsterdam ontwikkelen wij mentale e-health, virtual reality en andere innovatieve zorgdiensten. Zo komen zorg en preventie op een makkelijke en leuke manier bij de mensen thuis (of waar dan ook), op elk gewenst moment. Onze missie is om iedereen het vermogen te geven om zich een mentaal sterk bestaan eigen te maken met intelligente, inspirerende en verbindende psychologie on demand.
We zijn een snelgroeiende scale-up met jonge, enthousiaste en hardwerkende professionals. Therapieland biedt een zelfstandige functie in een persoonlijke, informele en gedreven organisatie. We werken hard, maar houden ook van een vrijdagmiddagborrel of skivakantie. Kom jij ons versterken? Stuur een motivatiebrief en cv naar vacature@therapieland.nl.

Een van de teams van Therapieland is team Data & Research, dit is een groeiend team dat zich bezighoudt met het organiseren, analyseren en onderzoeken van onze diensten en de onderliggende data. Wij ondersteunen Therapieland in het data-driven worden en bedenken data-gedreven oplossingen.

Je bent succesvol in deze rol als je:
Enkele jaren werkervaring hebt als Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Steward of Data Analist met programmeer ervaring.
Kennis hebt van data science en affiniteit met data engineering.
Bewezen ervaring hebt in het beheren van een data warehouse of data lake die data beschikbaar maken voor data science en BI-tooling, en kennis hebt van PostgresSQL en Google Cloud.
Solide programmeerervaring hebt in Python liefst Django, zowel in notebooks als native. Ervaring met Git en databasebeheer.
Woonachtig bent in Nederland.

Salaris tussen EUR 3000,- en 4500,- b.p.m met vakantiegeld natuurlijk en daar bovenop:
Een opleidingsbudget van EUR 500,00 per persoon per jaar
25 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis
Coaching, gericht op jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling
Onbeperkt gebruik van alle trainingen op ons E-learning platform
Een vergoeding als je met de fiets, het OV of de auto naar kantoor komt.
Pensioenregeling (+ overlijden- en arbeidsongeschiktheidsregeling) waarbij je de keuze hebt om bij te sparen
Alle tools die jij nodig hebt om fijn te werken zoals een Macbook
Je bepaalt zelf of je fulltime (40) of parttime (32 uur of meer) wilt werken
Een hybride werkomgeving met een Digital Nomad policy om te werken vanuit huis, kantoor of een tijdje in het buitenland
Samen met je team werk je aan innovatieve oplossingen voor psychologische zorg. Zo lever jij een bijzondere maatschappelijke bijdrage!

job_title: Azure DevOps Engineer | Den Bosch | CX management by using data | Salary up to €71k
listing_jobDesc:
CI/CD | Blob storage | .NET & C# | SQL & Python | Agile | 32 – 40 hours | Option to work from home
Responsibilities
In this position, you are responsible for running and automating the customers’ environment. Your responsibilities are building pipelines, development, setting up and managing SQL environments, setting up (other) environments and automating deployments. You work closely with the service team to ensure that customers are constantly receiving the best solutions. How can it be more efficient, smarter or simply better? Towards customers you act as an initiator. Clicking is something you can’t accept; you make sure that all adjustments come from the pipeline (as it should be). Furthermore, the organisation is still investigating what benefits Azure can add for them. Logically, you play a central role in this process. It’s up to you to apply improvement opportunities, using the Azure platform.

Listed your responsibilities are:

Provision and set up Azure pipelines
Investigate the IT and data needs of internal customers and respond to them
Dashboarding and tooling
Translating (new) IT technology into functionalities and possibilities for customers
Automate management and deployments

In addition, the organisation believes in focus, both in theory and practice. That’s why you’ll get a training program and knowledge development fully focussed on the Microsoft cloud. Individually or in groups you follow training courses. On top of that you regularly visit fairs and seminars that appeal to you.

Techniques

Obviously Azure is a big part of your role. The organisation is looking for an Azure evangelist: a person that knows Azure offers and ensures to be constantly up to date on new functionalities to ensure the organisation can keep on working with the newest offers that meet the standards as a front running data-science as a self-service platform.

You will be working with amongst others:

Azure devOps pipelines & ARS
Azure Cognitive search
Azure functions
You will get in touch with Azure functionality; the platform is using like Azure DataFactory, Azure Machine Learning
The organisation is a Microsoft ISV and in close contact with Microsoft to become a platform that seamlessly integrates with Microsoft offers.
Service tooling

Kubernetes and Datadog are used as legacy products. .NET and C# are used as backend programming languages. Furthermore SQL and Python are part of the tooling. Within Azure Blob storage is used. The team works Agile.

Company

This company helps their customers with the (often occurring) lack of insight regarding customer experience. There is often a lack of insight into what works well and what doesn’t when focussing on achieving measurable improvements. This organisation focusses on helping their clients achieve a measurable improvement in their CX initiatives. Clients are supported with actionable insights, with a huge impact on both revenue growth and loyalty, uncovering CX data insights faster, deeper and better.

Because the customer of today has more power than ever before, companies are responsible for acknowledging their needs. If companies make sure interactions are running smooth and continuously improving, they will increase their customers’ happiness. This organisation believes that the only and golden way to create an accurate view of that is impacting CX, is to enrich every interaction with journey-specific data and connect CX to business value: support companies in a systematic journey-improvement cycle, that increases customer happiness and loyalty, and decreasing churn and operational costs.

Examples of (big) customers are: Aegon, Ziggo, VGZ, Bol.com, CZ and ASR.

Team

The product development team consists of 3 backend developers, 2 frontend developers, 1 tester, 1 product owner & 1 UX designer. The manager describes the team as a passionate group of people who challenge each other to create a high-quality platform that focuses on easily providing insight into the value of customer data. The team members share an innovative and ambitious way of working.

The culture within the company and team can be described as young and dynamic, with an informal and open way of communicating. People are very ambitious and with good work ethics. Employees often have long employment records, which they contribute to the dynamic and international environment.

Requirements
You are either an OPS Engineer with DevOps & Azure experience
Or you have a background in Software Development (.NET and / or C#) with an ambition to learn more about DevOps (experience with pipelines and insights is a nice-to-have)
HBO/WO graduate or a proven track-record
You believe in the power of automation and dislike clicks
Able to speak and write English (English is primarily used within the company)
Terms and conditions
Salary up to €71.000
32-40 hours (4×9 not possible)
Option to work from home multiple days a week
25 vacation days (option to buy or sell 5 days)
Pension scheme
Travel allowance (19 ct/km) or NS business card
Training budget
Laptop and phone
Refund to buy ergonomic products to work from home
A cooperative, informal working atmosphere within a young team
5 minutes walking distance from train station

Do you have a PhD and ideas on uses how to incorporate Machine Learning into Atmospheric Cloud research? We are looking for a new Post Doc!
Job description
We invite you to apply for a postdoctoral position in the field of data-driven atmospheric cloud research. Within the scope of physics-informed machine learning, you will be free to set your own scientific emphasis. Possible research directions include data-driven model discovery under incorporation of partial physical knowledge such as conservation laws. Examples for applications include boundary-layer clouds and cloud microphysics.

You will join Franziska Glassmeier's lively group of several PhD students and a fellow postdoc. You will be embedded in the larger Atmospheric Science research team and will become a part of our active AI community. In addition to an exciting research project and a friendly and stimulating work environment, we can offer you generous funds for scientific travel.
Requirements
We are looking for a curiosity-driven, and conceptually-minded candidate who enjoys scientific discussion and computational data analysis.

To be considered for this position, you must have a PhD or comparable research experience. As a suitable candidate, you either have hands-on experience with machine-learning methods and at least a basic knowledge of physics, or a background in atmospheric cloud research and advanced data analysis. Prior experience with physics-informed machine-learning is not required but will be beneficial. We expect you to work independently as well as in small teams, to communicate fluently in English (oral and written), and to present your results to the scientific community in the form of peer-reviewed publications and presentations at international scientific meetings.
Conditions of employment
Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities. The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, a discount on health insurance and sport memberships, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.

Faculty Civil Engineering and Geosciences

CEG is convinced that Open Science helps to achieve our goals and supports its scientists in integrating Open Science in their research practice.

Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Civil Engineering & Geosciences.

The position is located within the department of Geoscience and Remote Sensing (GRS), one of the seven departments within the Faculty of CEG. GRS (with about 110 staff members of which 25 faculty staff) conducts a research programme in the disciplines of geodesy, remote sensing, data science, earth-oriented space research, and climate and atmospheric sciences. Met als doel waardevolle inzichten te genereren voor het management en andere stakeholders.Je maakt analyses om verschillende complexe vraagstukken op te lossen;Jij maakt voorspellende modellen op basis van grote hoeveelheden data;Je beheert statistische modellen, maakt ze operationeel en verbetert de modellen over tijd. Dit om de kwaliteit van de inzichten te waarborgen en te optimaliseren; Denk hierbij aan Marketing Mix Modelering, Store network model, Assortimentsoptimalisatie en Promotionele opimalisatie.Bijdragen aan de transitie om de organisatie meer data gedreven te maken.In deze functie krijg je veel vrijheid om samen met andere Data Specialisten de afdeling Data Analytics vorm te geven en succesvol te maken.Wat breng je mee?Je hebt 4 jaar werkervaring in een soortgelijke functie;Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift;Je hebt een afgeronde master in de richting van Econometrie, Data Science, Computer Science, Bedrijfswiskunde of een vergelijkbare opleiding;Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring in modellering en hebt kennis van programeren;Je beheerst de systemen Python, SQL en Microsoft Azure;Ervaring met DevOps is een must;Je bent communicatief vaardig, proactief, zelfstandig en beschikt over probleemoplossend vermogen.Wat bieden we jou?De salarisindicatie van een Data Scientist varieert van € 4.500 tot € 5.800 bruto per maand op basis van een fulltime dienstverband. Are you as an Data Scientist ready for the next step in your career? Xomnia offers you this opportunity! We are looking for a Data Scientist who is comfortable developing machine learning models ready for production. Someone who can lead our data science projects from the ideation phase into implementation and deployment whilst having one goal in mind, making the impact that our clients expect from working with Xomnia.

We believe in a can and will do mentality, and leading by example. As a Data Scientist at Xomnia you will work together with other experienced analytics translators, data scientists and engineers on challenging AI projects. In these projects you take on complex business problems from different domains such as fraud & anomaly detection, time series forecasts and recommender systems. From experience you know how to handle large volumes of data and apply the right kind of algorithm to the domain. You take pride in the work you create and develop according to the best practices in coding, because models should live in production environments and not only in jupyter notebooks.

You're eager and dedicated to keep on learning and developing yourself. It is rewarding for you to develop solutions together with your team that run in production, and make the impact that the organizations we partner with are looking for! And you enjoy celebrating these successes together.

What you will need
A minimum of 2 years experience in a position as data scientist, machine learning engineer, or similar
Master in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Econometrics or similar
Knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Excellent programming skills in Python
Experience with containerization in Docker
Experience in working with at (least) one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Enjoy sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourself
Team player with strong communication skills
What we offer
Competitive salary
25 vacation days and the possibility of taking unpaid leave
Room to grow and develop yourself
Paid time for self development and training budget of €5,000 a year
Challenging assignments
Company laptop of your choice
Work from home package
A monthly in-depth training facilitated by colleagues or external trainers
Nice colleagues who besides work also like to undertake activities
Company trips and activities like the Xomnia WKD, ski trip, and weekly sports activities
About us

We are Xomnia, the AI consulting company. We’re curious problem-solvers who believe data will change the way we live, work and communicate. Being at the forefront of this revolutionary change in a sustainable, positive way is what drives us.

We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.

Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses and it still feels like home. Like any family, we all feel comfortable just being ourselves.
Note; For this specific position, we are looking for a candidate that has an EU citizenship as we don’t offer any visa sponsorship.
